results.title: PHARMACOLOGIC TREATMENT OF HYPERALGESIA EXPERIMENTALLY INDUCED BY NUCLEUS PULPOSUS
results.text_hl: Objective: To evaluate the effect of anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ drugs (@CHEMICAL_Dexamethasone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003907 @@@dexamethasone@@@, @CHEMICAL_Indomethacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007213 @@@indomethacin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Indomethacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007213 @@@indomethacin@@@ plus @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@) and analgesic drugs (@CHEMICAL_Morphine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009020 @@@morphine@@@) on @DISEASE_Hyperalgesia @DISEASE_MESH:D006930 @@@hyperalgesia@@@ experimentally induced by the @<m>DISEASE_Fibrocartilaginous_embolism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C537927 @@@nucleus pulposus@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Fibrocartilaginous_embolism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C537927 @@@NP@@@) in contact with the L5 dorsal root ganglion (DRG).

citations.NLM: de Souza Grava AL, Ferrari LF, Parada CA, Defino HL. PHARMACOLOGIC TREATMENT OF HYPERALGESIA EXPERIMENTALLY INDUCED BY NUCLEUS PULPOSUS Rev Bras Ortop. 2010 Nov-Dec;45(6):569-76. PMID: 27026966
